article.title: Configuration using command-line options
article.description: An overview of Sync Gateway's command-line options

introduction.paragraph: To configure Sync Gateway, you can specify command-line options when you start Sync Gateway. Command-line options can only specify a limited set of configuration properties, and cannot be used to configure multiple databases. For more comprehensive configuration, use a JSON configuration file. For information about using a configuration file, see Configuration properties
Configuration determines the runtime behavior of Sync Gateway, including server configuration and the database or set of databases with which a Sync Gateway instance can interact.
introduction.note: You can only specify a small subset of configuration properties as command-line options. Two command-line options do not have corresponding configuration properties: -help and -verbose

body.paragraph: You can prefix command-line options with one hyphen (-) or with two hyphens (--). For command-line options that take an argument, you specify the argument after an equal sign (=), for example, -bucket=db, or as a following item on the command line, for example, -bucket db. Command-line options are case-insensitive. Here we use lower camel case.
Following are the command-line options that you can specify when starting Sync Gateway:
